intro: Dialesta discolor, commonly known as the variable bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dialesta discolor is known for its variability in flower color and leaf morphology, making it an interesting subject for botanical study.
